Frederick.Tuscarora Creek (Monocacy River) bridge: The Tuscarora Creek bridge is a 63.5-foot (19.4 m) single-span, steel, through-girder bridge with a floor beam/stringer system supporting a 12-inch thick concrete slab south of Walkersville, Maryland. Originally constructed by the Frederick and Pennsylvania Line Railroad Company (F&PL) in 1872. It was later rebuilt by the Pennsylvania railroad in 1907 as a thru girder concrete deck bridge using an older bridge from the Northern Central railroad.
